buildEssential
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Manual

    Manual

    Kim Seonghyun

    2017-10-20

    This R package is intended for resolving dependency issues over multiple different network nodes in enterprise level.

    For example, imagine a scenario where you want to create a private repository consists of your package and its dependencies. But, this can be a hard problem if we hope to manage this over multiple servers with different user group privilege, and even without the Internet connection for some nodes.

    This package aims to resolve those issues by easy-to-use APIs. The name is originated from build-essential package.

    How to Install

    install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("zedoul/buildEssential")

    Then you will have R6, XML, buildEsential, crayon, curl, desc, devtools, digest, git2r, httr, jsonlite, memoise, mime, miniCRAN, openssl, rstudioapi, whisker, withr, yaml in your library path. Use .libPaths() command to see your library path.

    For those of you want to have more detailed introduction, see inst/install.R code.

    How to Use

    First of all, I would recommend to start with writing two yaml files as follows:

    setting.yml:

    CRAN_url: http://ftp.acc.umu.se/mirror/CRAN/
miniCRAN_path: /Users/zedoul/Project/Temp/miniCRAN1
library_paths:
- main: /Users/zedoul/Project/Temp/R
  sub:  /Users/zedoul/Project/Temp/R2

package_types:
- source
- win.binary
- mac.binary

    descriptions.yml:

    descriptions:
- /Users/zedoul/Project/dplyr/DESCRIPTION
- /Users/zedoul/Project/ggplot2/DESCRIPTION
    • CRAN_url: Any CRAN mirror url.
    • miniCRAN_path: A directory for storing CRAN packages. Any of those package types is either source type or binary type.
    • library_paths: A set of search paths for R packages. See this page for more detail. You may want to have more than one path.
    • package_types: source, win.binary, and mac.binary by default.
    • descriptions: A set of DESCRIPTION path to get target package names.

    Note that they use absolute paths only, not relative paths. See inst/setup.R as an example.
